channel.title: PATA/ATA-100 Hard Disk
channel.description:
All this sales-tech mumbojumbo is giving me a headache, can someone who knows what they're on about please help me with finding the right hard disk?
My server is quite old so it only has PATA ports [not sata] so I've found this PATA hard disk: http://www.play.com/PC/PCs/4-/3439279/Western-Digital-250GB-2-5-PATA-8MB-Internal-Hard-Drive/Product.html#
I don't know if it will work though. It says it's ATA-100 and it's PATA so it seems as though it will, but it's a 2.5" model which are for laptops only? Even if it is a laptop hard disk will it work in my server?

item.title: PATA/ATA-100 Hard Disk
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

The cook from runescape:

Is there an actual difference in the hardware of a desktop hd and a laptop hd, or is the connector just smaller? I’m sure I could just make my own adapter if it needs to simply go to a bigger connector.

I cannot confirm if you can make your own adaptor but I would personally just buy one. Of course 2.5" and 3.5" disks work in the same way!

Read full topic

item.title: PATA/ATA-100 Hard Disk
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Thanks, that’s the best I could find on play.com because they only sell two PATA hd’s

Is there an actual difference in the hardware of a desktop hd and a laptop hd, or is the connector just smaller? I’m sure I could just make my own adapter if it needs to simply go to a bigger connector.

100Mbs is fine, I’d rather go with a site I trust and have used before than go to a new one for an extra 33Mbs which probably wont make much difference on my shitty server anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: PATA/ATA-100 Hard Disk
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

IF you want to use a 2.5" hard drive in a desktop computer you will need an adapter: http://www.geeks.com/details.asp?invtid=HD-108&cat=HDD

ATA-100 means the transfer speed is 100MB/s (Megabytes/second) however you should note that you can purchase 133MB/s transfer speed disk now.

You should note that PATA (Parallel ATA) is also known as IDE

Read full topic
